metadata.title: CVE-2014-9662 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
cff/cf2ft.c in FreeType before 2.5.4 does not validate the return values ofpoint-allocation functions, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted OTF font.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9662` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freetype2-demos - 2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4
libfreetype6 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freetype package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4').
